questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings (from worksheet)
left_items: A stitch in time saves nine
Where there is a will, there is a way
Honesty is the best policy
Practice makes perfect
right_items: Truthfulness is always rewarded
Practice makes a person perfect
Acting early prevents bigger problems
Hard work leads to success

pairs.left: A stitch in time saves nine
pairs.right: Acting early prevents bigger problems

pairs.left: Where there is a will, there is a way
pairs.right: Hard work leads to success

pairs.left: Honesty is the best policy
pairs.right: Truthfulness is always rewarded

pairs.left: Practice makes perfect
pairs.right: Practice makes a person perfect

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Actions speak louder than words
The early bird catches the worm
Don't judge a book by its cover
right_items: Those who act early have an advantage
Don't judge things or people by their appearance
What you do matters more than what you say
Don't be overconfident about something that hasn't happened yet

pairs.left: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
pairs.right: Don't be overconfident about something that hasn't happened yet

pairs.left: Actions speak louder than words
pairs.right: What you do matters more than what you say

pairs.left: The early bird catches the worm
pairs.right: Those who act early have an advantage

pairs.left: Don't judge a book by its cover
pairs.right: Don't judge things or people by their appearance

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Too many cooks spoil the broth
Rome wasn't built in a day
When in Rome, do as the Romans do
A penny saved is a penny earned
right_items: Saving money is as important as earning it
Great things take time to accomplish
Adapt to local customs and behavior
Too many people involved in a task can ruin it

pairs.left: Too many cooks spoil the broth
pairs.right: Too many people involved in a task can ruin it

pairs.left: Rome wasn't built in a day
pairs.right: Great things take time to accomplish

pairs.left: When in Rome, do as the Romans do
pairs.right: Adapt to local customs and behavior

pairs.left: A penny saved is a penny earned
pairs.right: Saving money is as important as earning it

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Better late than never
Look before you leap
Necessity is the mother of invention
All that glitters is not gold
right_items: Not everything that looks valuable is actually valuable
Need drives people to create solutions
It's better to do something late than not do it at all
Think carefully before acting

pairs.left: Better late than never
pairs.right: It's better to do something late than not do it at all

pairs.left: Look before you leap
pairs.right: Think carefully before acting

pairs.left: Necessity is the mother of invention
pairs.right: Need drives people to create solutions

pairs.left: All that glitters is not gold
pairs.right: Not everything that looks valuable is actually valuable

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Birds of a feather flock together
Every cloud has a silver lining
Two wrongs don't make a right
An apple a day keeps the doctor away
right_items: Responding to wrongdoing with wrongdoing is not justified
Healthy habits prevent illness
There is something good in every bad situation
People with similar interests spend time together

pairs.left: Birds of a feather flock together
pairs.right: People with similar interests spend time together

pairs.left: Every cloud has a silver lining
pairs.right: There is something good in every bad situation

pairs.left: Two wrongs don't make a right
pairs.right: Responding to wrongdoing with wrongdoing is not justified

pairs.left: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
pairs.right: Healthy habits prevent illness

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
Beggars can't be choosers
The pen is mightier than the sword
You can't have your cake and eat it too
right_items: You can't have everything both ways
Writing and words are more powerful than violence
When you need something, you can't be picky
What you have is more valuable than what you might get

pairs.left: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
pairs.right: What you have is more valuable than what you might get

pairs.left: Beggars can't be choosers
pairs.right: When you need something, you can't be picky

pairs.left: The pen is mightier than the sword
pairs.right: Writing and words are more powerful than violence

pairs.left: You can't have your cake and eat it too
pairs.right: You can't have everything both ways

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: A watched pot never boils
Barking dogs seldom bite
Blood is thicker than water
Curiosity killed the cat
right_items: Being too curious can lead to trouble
Family bonds are stronger than other relationships
Those who threaten often don't act
Time seems slower when you wait impatiently

pairs.left: A watched pot never boils
pairs.right: Time seems slower when you wait impatiently

pairs.left: Barking dogs seldom bite
pairs.right: Those who threaten often don't act

pairs.left: Blood is thicker than water
pairs.right: Family bonds are stronger than other relationships

pairs.left: Curiosity killed the cat
pairs.right: Being too curious can lead to trouble

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Empty vessels make the most noise
Fortune favours the brave
Great minds think alike
Haste makes waste
right_items: Rushing leads to mistakes and wastage
Smart people often have similar ideas
Those with little knowledge talk the most
Bold people are more likely to succeed

pairs.left: Empty vessels make the most noise
pairs.right: Those with little knowledge talk the most

pairs.left: Fortune favours the brave
pairs.right: Bold people are more likely to succeed

pairs.left: Great minds think alike
pairs.right: Smart people often have similar ideas

pairs.left: Haste makes waste
pairs.right: Rushing leads to mistakes and wastage

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Ignorance is bliss
Jack of all trades, master of none

right_items: Being happy helps you feel better

Sometimes not knowing is better

pairs.right: Sometimes not knowing is better

pairs.right: Someone who does many things but excels at nothing

pairs.left: Knowledge is power
pairs.right: Being informed gives you an advantage

pairs.left: Laughter is the best medicine
pairs.right: Being happy helps you feel better

questions.instruction: Match the proverbs with their meanings
left_items: Make hay while the sun shines
No pain, no gain
Out of sight, out of mind
The grass is always greener on the other side
right_items: We forget things we don't see often
Other people's situations always seem better than ours
You must work hard to achieve results
Take advantage of opportunities when available

pairs.left: Make hay while the sun shines
pairs.right: Take advantage of opportunities when available

pairs.left: No pain, no gain
pairs.right: You must work hard to achieve results

pairs.left: Out of sight, out of mind
pairs.right: We forget things we don't see often

pairs.left: The grass is always greener on the other side
pairs.right: Other people's situations always seem better than ours
